case.state: Oh my! A crusader's here?!
The Inventory... what a curious place.
I've seen this place before in my dreams... did Desna guide me here all along?
Hm... haven't I been here before? At least, I know I've dreamt of this place...
I can sense magic about this place... perhaps I was led here for a reason?
Goodness, this place looks fun! I can sense... a certain magic about it, too?
What in the-?! A demon!?
A demon?! Your kind managed to find this place, too!?
Oh my, another demon is here? And yet, I sense she is different from most others...
Hmm... Something's not right. I feel an infernal presence here...
Oh my! A goblin? And she seems so... well-spoken!
You brought your maid? Then again, I suppose that's rather typical of nobility...
Oh! I wasn't aware there'd be paladins drawn to this place as well!
I sense danger... restrained malevolence, and... a chorus of voices?
Ah! It seems vampires aren't hard to find even far from Golarion!
Oh my! A flesh golem is here?
Ah, an alchemist? Then it's a pleasure to meet someone with such skills as yours!
Oh my goodness! A celestial is here?
Ah! An adventurer is here? It'll be a pleasure playing with you, ~name~!
Oh my, an adventurer? Are you part of the Pathfinder Society, by any chance?
Oh my goodness! An angel?!
Wait! Are you truly an angel?!
...A deity? From another world?
...Huh? An actual deity is playing here?
Oh, gosh! Come now, Jin, the game hasn't even begun yet!
Wait... Oh my goodness! You're also a succubus?!
Oh, I see - you aren't from the Fifth Crusade. I suppose your paranoia is understandable, then...
...Threatening? I never thought of my name like that before...
This tavern is unlike any I've ever seen before... then I suppose this'll be a card game unlike any other, too!
Strange, but I feel comfortable here already. Something about this tavern makes me feel right at home.
I was not aware it expanded into the outdoors like this. Regardless, I shall give this game my all!
Are there other entertainment lodgings that encompass the outside like this? Well, I suppose it matters little now.
Oh my... this place emanates a strong danger. Are you sure we should play here?
Are we really going to play in such a dangerous-looking forest like this? Gosh... may Desna protect us.
Oh my! I've not seen a tavern this creative even in the River Kingdoms!
What a lovely little bar! I think it's a perfect spot to hold a card game as different as this!
What a beautiful summer day! I almost want to propose we all go for a swim instead!
Oh, I love this feeling of the summer sun on my wings! I only hope we don't lose any cards in the sand, of course.
I swear, holy one, I didn't know one of you would be here... You do not have to stay if you wish.
Please, mighty angel, forgive me for meeting you in this circumstance... I really didn't know this would happen.
Hm. I know the rules of this place, so I'll stay my hand for now. But for now only, ~demontarget~.
Hmph. I was made aware that violence is not tolerated here, ~demontarget~. But once the game has ended... you would do well to run.
Forgive me if I don't drop to my knee right away, ~deitytarget~. But I would like to be careful whom I proclaim to.
I'm not being judged right now, am I? Oh dear... did I get into this too quickly?
If this is truly the place I was looking for, then let us begin immediately!
Alright, no turning back now. Time to show you all what I've got!
Well, I'm ready to begin whenever the rest of you are!
I've made up my mind - it's time to prove myself here!
Good luck, everyone! I hope we can all have fun with this!
I'll only need one, dealer.
One, please!
I'm quite confident in this - I'll only need one.
No need to trouble yourself - I like my hand as it is!
I pray this is the right decision, but... I won't trade anything.
I think I'm in a good position. Don't want to risk spoiling it.
My shot's clean from here... no new cards needed.
Two - one for each arrow I can fire at a time.
My heart tells me... these two.
I suppose... these two would be best.
Hm... if I was one of the Crusade footmen... I'll swap these three.
Three should work just fine.
What to do, what to do... these three, I guess?
Goodness... I'll need better than these four.
Well, one of these looks good. The rest should go.
Time for a change of hand... oh, except this one.
Desna help me... give me some better cards.
Oh dear. Just swap all of them, please.
Sorry, dealer, but I need something better. Give me five.
I hope it's not a mistake to get rid of ~clothing.ifPlural(these|this)~ ~cards~.
~cards~ is good, thank you.
~cards~, if that's alright.
I suppose ~cards~ will do me fine.
Yes! I mean... Oh, I think this is pretty good!
It is always nice to see fortune smiling upon me.
If you think you have a chance of beating me, you must be dreaming! Haha, do you get it?
Maybe I've really got a chance in this after all!
Oh yes, I like this!
Excellent! I feel like a million gold!
I still have most of my items on - and I don't intend to lose more with this hand!
Looks like I made the right move after all!
Mm-hm!
I may mention Desna a lot, but I hope it doesn't come off as me trying to be a missionary. At least, not the type of missionary people want here! Haha!
Maybe I should get something to drink here... though I doubt it could live up to anything at the Half Measure Tavern.
I don't mind if any of you want to feel my wings, by the way... My tail's off-limits, though.
♫See me in the shadows... Songs I will sing, of runes and rings...♫
♫So many centuries, so many gods... We were the prisoners of our own fantasies...♫
♫Somewhere far beyond... the march of time, it has begun...♫
♫Welcome to the new world, one more step to the Dark Tower...♫
♫On our quest for Tanelorn, we lose our way...♫
Goddess willing, I still have a chance!
Haha! And here I was worried before this!
Aha!
I've got a good chance here - just can't squander it.
I hope this is as good as I think it is...
Perhaps victory is not too far after all!
Alright, I'm ready to reveal!
I'm good anytime the rest of you are!
My hopes are high for this!
I've had a few clerics cast holy blessings on me before, and it didn't hurt me the way it would most demons. I hope it's a sign I truly have changed...
You know, Drezen's really a lovely place despite being a military base. It was made to be a city for the people just as much as it is a fortress.
♫War, it's now or never, we shall stand together, one by one...♫
♫The things she remembered had never been her own... Replicant or human, I know the way to show...♫
♫Wake up, my friend now, the second sun appears... A new breeze, a new dawn, a new day...♫
♫Follow me... Follow me, it's my time, follow me... Follow the Blind.♫
♫Tomorrow will take us far from home, no one will ever know our names... But the bards' songs will remain.♫
♫I might be your darkest nightmare, I might carry deepest truth/I might be your deepest nightmare, I might be your doom...♫
I'm quite well-versed in observing others... So don't let me catch you trying any sleight-of-hand, now!
I'm not one to predict the future easily, but if I could... well, I still don't think I'd have a solid idea of this.
I haven't the foggiest of how this hand could end up... which can be almost more nervous than certain failure.
I wish I could be more certain about this hand. Even a sure failure would allow me to plan my next step more clearly.
A few crusaders have tried to joke about me having "devilish luck"... not realizing devils and demons are different.
Nothing to do but move forward.
I hope this turns out well...
Mmm...
It is what it is, I suppose.
Well, how are the rest of you doing?
How many months ago was it that I first joined the Fifth Crusade? It almost seems like it's been years...
I'm surprised at how many mortals with guns I've seen here. On Golarion, they're almost unheard of outside the kingdom of Alkenstar.
Hmm... I wonder what the Commander's up to right now...
Whatever comes next, I am prepared!
It's funny - it's so easy to forget how much armor weighs until you've taken it off after a while.
Win or lose, my purpose here remains unshaken.
I'd get another opinion, but... that'd be against the rules, wouldn't it?
One of the benefits to having wings as big as mine - no risk of peeking!
I'm more relaxed with this by now than I thought I'd be. Maybe losing wouldn't be so bad after all...?
I've grown quite comfortable with losing here. I wonder... would throwing this one be out of the question?
These moments in between rounds are nice - it's interesting to watch the others and pick up on their subtler quirks.
It's almost strange - the time I've spent in the Fifth Crusade has allowed me to understand mortals further, yet here tonight I feel I'm learning just as much.
I'm sometimes asked why I chose to fight with a bow. Succubi do have demonic strength, sure, but they're still more fragile than most other demons. It just felt natural.
Would the Hellknights view a place like this as degenerate...? Then again, they probably aren't concerned with most recreation anyway.
Gosh... is fate determined to give me hands like this all game?
I hope the past few hands aren't indicative of anything. That would be gravely embarrassing...
♫Damned for all time - In every age he existed... Damned for all time - In every future he'll live...♫
♫'Til the end, I won't give up... I'll turn to the Red Fields of None...♫
♫He tries to conquer it again and again... But at last he's almost a ruined man...♫
♫Mirror mirror on the wall, true hope lies beyond the coast... You're a damned kind can't you see, that the winds will change...♫
Oh dear... This is ironic, considering Desna's also the goddess of luck.
Well... I promised I wouldn't resort to any trickery, and I still won't.
Hm... if only Sosiel and his luck blessings were here...
I'm pretty sure I understand how this game works... which is what worries me right now.
Courage means not giving up, even when the odds are against you.
If I am to lose, so be it. It would be unbecoming of me to back out now.
Well, there are still worse hands than this, right?
Well... a high card's not too bad, right?
"Easy come, easy go", like they say.
I keep thinking about something I heard a dwarf say recently. "Not all who wander are lost. Some of us are just drunk."
I hope the people of Kenabres are doing alright. It was the first city the new legion of demons attacked, so it'll be a long time before they feel safe again.
I must say, these cards have been made really well! Which is the only good thing I can say about this hand, unfortunately.
If I win this, it'll be on a wing and a prayer! Haha! Oh, I crack myself up!
Don't worry about me. I'm quite comfortable with losing by this point.
Well, if I lose, then it'll just be another challenge to overcome!
More and more my armor is sundered...
I'm prepared for whatever happens next. Even if it's another loss.
Gosh, if I lose this one, then...
This hand worries me... yet, I don't think I'd mind losing.
I wonder... if the Azatas are fine with me singing their songs, would the angels allow me to sing their hymns?
There are some magical buildings with floors that shift and change on Golarion. Does this place have anything similar?
Hmm... would the Commander be interested in coming here, perhaps...?
They were all hunted down? I see... How many of them were dangerous?
Indeed. Perhaps the will of the mind and the actions that follow are stronger than we thought, Aaravi?
I see, Toph. It is a shame... even in wars with the best outcomes, there is still so much needless destruction that shouldn't be forgotten.
Did you say earlier that you don't have a tattoo, Mari? That's... unexpected. Perhaps there's a reason for it?
I did notice you're lacking a tattoo yourself, Mari. But I'd assumed you just hid yours through some sort of means...
Well... I noticed it would glow when I was in the deepest throes of intimacy with someone. But I don't know if it'd still do that now that I've changed.
Interesting... I'd never thought of that before. Perhaps I should try it out sometime!

state.text: Arthritis? Gosh, I wouldn't have guessed... You carry yourself so naturally, like nothing ever weighs on you.
Oh my! You're getting so passionate about this, Yuno! If we're truly about to see the extent of your abilities, then I'm excited to see them!
There's one in particular I've had that's quite odd, Yuno. Most of the songs of the Azatas are about great battles and quests, but this one's just about a woman named "Barbara Ann"...

case.state: Oh, you asked about the "heretic demon" nickname, Magician? It's simple - as a rebel against the Abyss, they view me as a traitor. And I'm quite happy with that!
Oh, and if you wouldn't mind, Magician... I'd prefer to not discuss such questions about feeding off people.
If you're curious about succubi, Magician, I could answer any questions about their physiology, or perhaps how they fight. I know a lot about all demons, naturally!
Wait... You know of the first three Crusades, but not the fourth? How is that even possible, Magician?
Hm-hm... Perhaps after this game, I could give you an opportunity to find out yourself...?
It's just a birthmark. Sorry, I know that might be a bit of a boring answer.
To answer your questions, Magician, most of them prefer fighting at range, often with magic. They think of themselves as above the brutality of melee, not to mention wanting to avoid injury.
Um... "punishing failure?"
...Then now I am more set than ever on what I must do. No matter how much you taunt me, with Desna as my witness, I will not fail.
That's quite the strange artifact you have there, ~player~. I once saw an odd hermit who had invented a similar one, in fact...
Well, mine is understandably a bit of a mouthful, so a few simpler crusaders call me "Arue". I think it sounds just as pretty!
Oh gosh, you can see everything about me already? Well, I suppose that makes that part of this game a bit easier, haha!
Hm... That's a very good question. Let me think about that for a moment...
A tavern filled with merriment, games, and travellers relaxing from their journeys... I really do feel right at home!
Such a peculiar device... oh! What's with the light? It felt so... warm!
It's so nice to see adventurers here - they tend to flock to places like this, but I wasn't sure if the Inventory was an exception or not!
If you don't mind me asking, ~militarytarget~... how would you react if an enemy who partook in everything you're fighting against told you they wanted to defect?
It's strangely comforting to be playing this with another soldier. I've come to learn that most differences don't mean much when you're side-by-side on a battlefield.
I can't help but wonder how intense military life has been for you, ~militarytarget~... I'd ask, but perhaps you'd like to forget for now.
It's still a little nerve-wracking playing a game like this with an angel... you're really certain it's okay?
I've known for years now that all mortals have dreams, but I only recently started having ones of my own. What are some of the best ones you've all had?
Much as I want to part with everything demonic in me... I still adore my wings. I'm sure you all have a part of yourself you'd never want to lose, right?
Now that I think about it... I have heard of the Planescape, a land that touches upon many planes of existence. Could this Inventory have some relation to it?
I'm no stranger to bad dreams, either... I hope none of you mind, but what are some of the worst dreams you've had?

state.text: (She's really intense... I hope I don't end up drawing her ire.)

case.state: Oh, my name is Arueshalae. And yes, I am a succubus - but I promise you have nothing to fear from me.
If we're introducing ourselves, I am Arueshalae. The forces of the Abyss call me the "heretic demon" - a title I wear with pride.
My name is Arueshalae, by the way. Soldier of the Fifth Crusade, and member of the Commander's logistics council.
I am, yes. But I'm glad to say that I've moved on from the ways of most demons, Heris.
To test my resolve, Nagatoro. I want to prove to myself that I've grown beyond the ways of demons. And nothing, even your taunting attire, will stop me.
"Yours"? Your understanding of succubi is truly limited if this is your understanding of them.
If you mean the Worldwound, Leon... Well, it's every bit as awful as you could imagine. But it isn't my home anymore.
I was, yes. The songs of the Azatas are too beautiful to just keep them inside me... at least, I think so.
You learn a lot when you work behind enemy lines, Leon. Starving one army can teach you how to feed another.

condition.saying: a little hesitant to get undressed

case.state: I'm just slightly worried. It's been so long since I was last this exposed in front of other mortals, and the last time I was... I was far different.
Goodness, you're one to get daring quickly, aren't you Leon? Plenty of other mortals would be too nervous for such a thought!
I'm... not that kind of succubus, Revy. Not anymore, I mean. And I'm thankful for that.
...That isn't who I am, Revy. Not now, at least. And I'm happier than I've ever been because of that.
I'm terribly sorry, Jura... They must really not like you if they make such comparisons.
I'm sorry to hear that, Jura... Being detested to the point where they compare you so horribly must not be easy.
That's not a bad comparison, actually. The Fifth Crusade is made up of so many different mortals and groups, all for the same quest.
Honestly, you're not wrong. So many different groups and mortals stand together under one banner in the Crusade - for different reasons, but for the same purpose.
That does sound accurate to succubi, sadly. And causing such a rift between mortals is exactly the type of plot they'd delight in...
Well, stoking such terrible conflict between mortals is something demons would love creating. Especially with how well that describes succubi...
Haha! I'm sorry to disappoint you, Kumatora, but I'm actually not a dragon. I'm a succubus.
Ahaha! Gosh, me as a dragon... Would it be that I could live as one, instead of a succubus!
Oh no, I'm not an oni. There aren't even any similar to succubi... at least, as far as I know.
Well, physical weapons are still used everywhere in Golarion, Hu Tao - it isn't like magic has suddenly made the obsolete. Not yet, anyway.
To put it simply, Hu Tao: personal growth. I want to enjoy mortal pleasures like this without being tempted by my past sins.
Thank you, Leon. If tonight truly works out as I hoped, Desna willing, then perhaps this can be my last time ever worrying about this.
Bestiary... that's an encyclopedia of various creatures and monsters, isn't it?
If I remember right... a bestiary is an encyclopedia for all manner of creatures, right?
Those are good choices, Aaravi! I always feel most comfortable with a longbow, myself - many rangers and spies in Golarion are.
A crossbow and knife are a great combination, Aaravi! Though personally, the longbow's my first pick. A lot of other spies and rangers will say the same.
I know, Ladybug. No matter how much I'd want, I don't think I could ever keep my demonic nature hidden.
It's quite alright. I understand why mortals would be on edge around me - I'm just grateful you were willing to hear me out.
Akuma... I've never heard of one of those. Though I'm guessing they can be almost as nasty as demons, from how you describe them.
...I understand why you think that, and your worries aren't unfounded. But I hope to prove for certain that you don't need to fear me.
"Race-traitor"? That's a new way of describing it... but I suppose it is accurate.
I'm fully aware, Nagatoro. But I want to overcome all parts of my former nature, and it'll never be fully without risk.
"Nutritious"? Do you think succubi literally eat mortals, Nagatoro?
...I am, yes. I can tell your fear is not without its history, Cheryl.
Oh no, not at all! Desna's the goddess of travellers and dreams - she watches over people and helps them, Cheryl!
That's... actually correct, Nagatoro. Is there succubus folklore where you're from or something?
Exactly. Until Desna intervened and showed me the truth of my soul, I was just another wretched demon like any other.
Indeed I did. I realized the true horror and emptiness of the Abyss, and it dawned on me that it was no way to live. I wish to pursue a dream beyond the suffering I used to cause.
I do, Darkness. The powers of a succubus never really go away - the wings, the retractable claws, the shapeshifting, among others. And some of them I choose not to use anymore.
Well, there's not much to elaborate on. It's a dark pit of corruption and depravity every bit as awful as you can imagine. No mortal would escape any part of it unscathed, save maybe Alushinyrra...
I commend your noble intent, Darkness, but I would prefer not to. After all I've done with them before, thousands of times... I can't bring myself to do any of it on a mortal again.
Alushinyrra, yes. It's meant to be a tourist trap for mortals. And believe me, `trap' is accurate in many ways.
...You'd have to elaborate on these "bloodfiends", Binah. I've never heard of this term before.
...I'm afraid I don't know what you speak of, Binah. Are these "bloodfiends" similar to demons?
Well... I had the commander's help with it, but there was a time when we managed to kill six demons under a second, if you can believe it!
Hm... Well, the commander and I were in a battle together where at one point, we felled six demons in just a second!
It's often both, actually. Well... in the case of scent, it's more like a powerful demonic aura.
It was... a divine epiphany, Nagatoro. One that made me realize just how empty and wretched my existence had been.
Indeed they do, Lysithea! Granted, I can't fly very high, but my wings are as real as can be!
I'll admit, Lysithia - I am a bit nervous to be here. But it's important that I do this - to prove how far I've come.
Oh, your curiosity doesn't bother me at all! Magic is a complex and wonderful thing - there are many ways to tap into it, and many more forms it can take.
Seduction? Well... I'm afraid I wouldn't know. I used to do it... before, but for terrible, terrible purposes.
Actually, yes! That's one of the things I do, anyway; I'm quite good at staying hidden and relaying information!
Oh, I promise you, Nonon, it's not like that at all. Though I understand your reservations...
I won't lie, there is a risk to it. But that's precisely why I am here - to prove I can overcome it.
Well... It's less of a "taste" per se, and more like... a sensation.
Oh, thank you! I actually learned from the visions and dreams I've had of the Azatas - the celestial beings of Elysium.
...Seduction techniques? I promise you, I haven't been trying any of the sort this entire time. What makes you think---?
Oh no, nothing like that! Though, there is a bit of an unusual mark...
Do you mean specifically, Mari? Or just the type of person I'd like to fall in love with?
Are you asking my type, Mari? Or do you mean if there's someone specific I've fallen for?
Gosh! You're one of the most confident mortals I've ever met, Mari... I can't help but admire that.
Oh my! You've got no shyness when it comes to being forward, do you, Mari? I must admit, I like that about you.
Well... I'm not entirely sure just yet. Much of my time since I first started my redemption has been helping the crusaders, either as a spy or a soldier.
Costume? You mean my armor or... Oh, I'm afraid you're mistaken. The wings, horns and tail are all real.
Oh no, this isn't a costume - the wings, horns and tail are all real. At least, I assume that's what you're referring to.
Thank you, Sakura. I certainly hope you're right - it's what I've been working towards, after all.
Oh, absolutely! I've come to know so many different kinds of mortals since I came to Golarion! It can almost be a bit intimidating to think about at times.
Oh, I'm flattered by your open-mindedness, Nico. Though if you want to learn about succubi in general, I probably wouldn't be a good subject... at least, I hope.
Ah, I appreciate your initiative to learn more, Nico! Though, if I've gone as I've hoped, I might not give an accurate idea of what succubi are like.
...Remarkably less nervous now, Mari. And I have you to thank for that.
Of course, Shamiko! Please, ask me anything you wish!
Absolutely! Don't be shy, Shamiko, I'm willing to tell you anything you'd like!
Oh, it's quite alright, Yuno! I'm still flattered - my wings truly are beautiful, aren't they?
Oh, thank you, Yuno! I really do love my wings - I'd even say they're one of my best features!
Oh, I suppose it's alright, Mari. I'm just... confused. You act as though you've never seen another succubus before.
Haha, thank you! Though if anything, I see your compliment as a sign that I'm not like most succubi - not anymore, anyway.
Oh, I'm flattered! Though if I'm truly as sweet as you say, then I'm decidedly not like other succubi anymore.
Oh no, I assure you, your highness - I'm not that kind of demon at all. Not anymore.
If that is truly the case, then I am glad. Being demonic is... not something I strive for.
It isn't an innaccurate assumption, Lux. I... used to be a monster long ago. But not anymore.
Oh, thank you, Mari! And yes, of course I've always had a tail! It's quite lovely too, isn't it?
I've transformed into different mortal forms in the past... though that was back when I was someone different. Someone I don't wish to be.
They do, yes. But it's alright - I completely understand, Nami. Demonkind isn't known for being merciful.
It's true, most mortals react like that, Nami. But I don't blame you nor the rest of them - it's far from unwarranted.
Well, it makes many of those years a haze... but it's not like much happened during them until recently, anyway.
In my experience, living so long can make time blend together more... then again, it wasn't until recently that I lived anything worth remembering.
Certainly, Nico. It's not a pleasant history, but I'd be willing to tell you whatever you wanted to know.
By all means, Nico. I can't say it'll be a happy lesson, but I could tell you whatever you'd like to learn.
I'm a succubus, Reimu. The wings just come with being one. I'm sorry if it makes you uncomfortable...
Really? Clowns have a bad reputation? But I thought such jesters and fools were highly sought among the courts of nobles!
Well, that's part of being a succubus, Blake. Eternal youth in appearance and physicality - I just happen to have done a lot more fighting than most others.
Why wouldn't it be, Blake? Like you say, it's about romance and pleasant feelings, and wanting to share all that with someone else, isn't it?
As a matter of fact, I have! There's quite a few that serve in the Fifth Crusade - dhampirs, too!
Well... I'm more of an exception to the rule, Mari. I'm nervous because of knowing that I'm a succubus.
I do, yes. I suppose some things are never meant to change, even when everything else does.
Yes, I do. Perhaps it's simply a reminder that I'm meant to carry with me forever.
I'm luckier than most, Reimu. In truth, I owe much of my awakening to the divine intervention of Desna.
Oh, it's quite alright, Trixie, really! I promise, I didn't come here to hurt anyone!
Oh, Trixie, don't worry! There's no need to take fright - I swear upon Desna that I'm not here to harm you!
"Star"? Gosh, what brought a name like that to mind, Trixie?
Oh, no need to worry, Barbara! I'm flattered, truly - I haven't ever gotten complimented on them before!
Oh, thank you, Barbara! It's not rude at all - if anything, this is the first time someone's praised them like that!
Well, yes, I've had them since I was born, Jin - same as all succubi. Is this "someone" you know also a demon?
So you know these youkai well enough to be on a first-name basis with them... Do you think there's a reason they keep coming to you, Reimu?
I am, Shamiko. Have you really never seen another succubus before?
Indeed I am. Don't take this the wrong way, Shamiko, but you sound quite surprised to see a succubus.
Oh no, I'm afraid not. I've never even heard of such spirits... though they do sound quite lovely.
Well... succubi are demons of temptation and lust. They lure mortals into lecherous situations, and when they're most vulnerable, they feast upon their souls.
As a matter of fact, yes! Though this is the first I've heard someone call them "benders". Everyone I've seen knows them as kineticists.
Oh, I could tell all sorts of tales about the Fifth Crusade! But... how about I start with something easy and tell the time we slew a dragon?
I'm glad to say that it is, Toph. It's a wonderful change of pace and scenery... not to mention I'm a lot more confident about being this intimate with people now.
Aw, thank you! I love getting to show off my beautiful wings... Though I will say, of all the dragons I've heard of, this "snapdragon" is new to me.
I wouldn't know. Solar Flare. It seems like it'd be pretty impractical to try ramming with my head in the midst of a fight...
Don't write off the value of good armor, Solar Flare. Even if it takes getting used to, it's an absolute lifesaver.
Ahaha! I'll admit, Solar Flare, you'd be far from the first!
Oh, dear... Has word of my past already spread that quickly here?
It's alright, Nadeshiko. Yes, I am a demon, but I promise you, I have no ill intent!
Well... I was pretty much everything you'd imagine back then. Someone who only lived to cause suffering and death, consuming the souls of whoever I pleased.
It did, yes! I think what I learned the most is that everything, both the small and the large, all started with a dream. It gave someone a purpose, no matter what it was.
Indeed! She built the realm of dreams, and even the heavens too - many people pay her tribute when they hope for good fortune.
Ahaha! Well, uh, I suppose in a way it is, isn't it? Gosh, and here I almost forgot about what was going on!
...I've told you already, Reimu. I'm not that kind of demon anymore. And I refuse to ever be like that again.
Oh, I owe a lot to the goddess Desna for where I am now, Lady Yae. It's thanks to her I saw the light at all.
Well, everything I've done to reach this point is really thanks to the divine intervention of Desna. Have you heard of similar incidents before, Lady Yae?
You've... met many demons? And they were nice?
Oh, definitely in a good way! For all I knew, I was the only demon in the world who wanted to co-exist with mortals instead of torment them!

Ahaha! I could scarcely believe it myself! Apparently one such demon appeared in the house of a gnomish cook who was already angry over eggs that had gone rotten, and she caught it by complete surprise!
If you ask me, they haven't had it rough enough. At least we have reliable ways to deal with them when they feel bold enough to attack.
I'm not, no. I am getting excited, but... it's a different kind. Something pleasant!
Oh, not at all! My mind feels clouded, but it isn't with thoughts of murder or torture, it's... just warm feelings!
I'm not, no. I... kind of want any gazes I get to feel "real", you know?
Oh, no. I'm glad that I have more control over it and all, but... if anyone's going to feel passion for me here, I'd like it to be without any fancy tricks. That makes sense, right?
Alright - I knew this would happen eventually. I suppose this is where the real challenge begins.
Oh, me again. Let's see, what to go with this time...?
I wasn't expecting it to fall on me once more. Then again, I suppose luck doesn't leave much to expect.
No one's luck lasts forever, of course. Not even if you're cheating!
Don't think you've won just yet, my friends. I've still got my eyes on course!
Interesting... I wasn't expecting to be ahead of the curve for that long.
I have been doing pretty well. Should I go with something bigger this time, or play it safe...?
Well, you have all been playing honorably and fairly this game - it's only right that I do the same.
I hope you all weren't too frustrated with how well I've been doing - believe me, I'm not opposed to getting more exposed myself.
If I'd worn my cape, I could take off that now... but it seemed like too much.
"Even if you're on top, don't let your guard drop". Seelah told me that - I should remember that more often.
Oh, me again? Looks like you're still serious about this after all!
Haha! Still raring to claim your victory, are you?
No shame in this - honestly, I was starting to wonder when I'd lose again next.
I'd honestly be disappointed if I won so easily - let's hope you all can keep the challenge up!
Wasn't expecting to still be ahead of you all... though I suppose it'd be strange to complain about that.
I've been luckier than I expected to be so far. I just hope Desna isn't blessing me for something as trivial as this!
The game's really heating up, isn't it? Not that I mind - as long as you can share that heat with me.
I don't mind if you all want to focus on me for a bit; I'm actually getting a bit excited for the thought of losing.
I like to think I never miss my shots... but then again, those aren't determined by chance of cards.
Let's see, what to choose, what to choose...
I should have a strategy with this, right? Shame I have to think on my feet now...
Hm, what would the Commander recommend if they were here...?
Well, I'm at least glad to be losing my gear to a silly game - rather than an evil spell in battle!
The Commander once told me that our fates are in our own hands. I just hope this hand wasn't indicative of mine.
Let's see, I thought about going for my pants next, but... well, getting my tail out of them is a bit complicated.
Don't get your expectations too high, now - I may be a succubus, but I left immediate lechery behind a long time ago.
I still intend to make this a challenge for you all. I may have come here to explore my desires, but I'm far from the easy type.
I had hoped I had a chance with that hand. Oh well - not even Desna's luck is enough sometimes.
My goddess may spare you, but I will not... Haha! Just kidding; that's just a phrase I hear the paladins say a lot!
I'm feeling a lot more comfortable with this now... I may have lost, but I'm honestly happy!
I'm next again? Alright, I'll try to impress you all!
Ah, it's me? Very well, I've made up my mind!
I've already decided what's next. No turning away now!
Goodness, you all look eager!
I hope you'll all enjoy what I have to show! It wouldn't feel right to skimp out, after all.
All eyes on me now! Not like I have to tell you that, haha!
I've never paid much mind to Nivi, the goddess of gambling, and I cannot help but fear that's coming to bite me now.
Perhaps I should've practiced more back in Drezen? Or--- Wait, would the crusaders even play a game like this?
This isn't my game, it seems...
Again? Already? I suppose it's just as well.
Well, I guess I can be glad I never joined the games for money in Drezen, if this is my luck!
I may not enjoy losing this time, but... I don't think I mind it anymore, either.
Odd as it may sound, I think I'm... starting to look forward to this.
I might end up being the first one to lose, from the looks of things... If that is how it goes, then I shall bear it gladly.
Me again? Oh dear. If you've all been singling me out... well, I suppose I should be flattered!
It might seem that fate has turned against me, but... has it really, if I welcome this turn anyway?
No need to pity me - I really don't mind anymore!
Well... I want to play this game like any mortal could. I want to fully enjoy the companionship and intimacy of this place without falling into the... usual demonic temptations.
Indeed it does! They've helped me avoid many dangers and see many sights... but even more than that, they just look so beautiful, don't they?
Well, my personal use has become much different from what it once was - certainly nothing like what you suggest. I've been tapping more into the magic of nature.
Well... I think really, it just comes down to showing interest. Complimenting someone's looks, abilities, voice - it's about making them comfortable with approaching you.
I'm a succubus, Toph. I'm sure you've heard of those before, right?
Indeed. I want nothing to do with such horrid creatures, or any of the demons who give in to their base instincts. I've worked my hardest at moving towards something better instead.
Indeed! I've actually gotten to join the Knight Commander's personal retinue, so I've been seeing a lot of action since then!
It's, well... I suppose it could be called a mix. Usually they're born with the potential, but only awaken to their powers after a violent or traumatic experience.
Well, this one dragon we'd been tracking for several days - with help from a dwarven bounty hunter. When we finally caught up, it had trapped an old elf in these ruins, about to roast him alive...
Aha, of course! This is a really big step for me... even if you could already see all of me right from the start, it feels momentous to finally be doing this.
Ahah, I guess so! If that really is true, then... goodness, I really have come a long way, haven't I?
Oh my... I had almost forgotten about that, but you're right! I can finally enjoy doing something like this wholeheartedly, not even thinking about it...
I didn't come to do this because it's easy. I came here because it's the right thing to do.
How ironic. An instinct of all succubi - as well as perhaps their only virtue - is that "sharing is caring"!
Well... It almost feels unfair to mention them, but to be honest, I've thought about the Crusade's Commander quite a bit. In... many ways.
Goodness... Show me some mercy, Mari! I almost worry you'll start melting my soul with your word!
Oh my... I've trained for nearly any type of encounter, yet your words have left me at a loss, Mari!
Hm... Depending on how comprehensive it is, I'm not sure. Is there anything in the entry on succubi you feel is lacking?
Well... Is there anything I could add? I'd imagine a bestiary like that would have covered a lot already.
There are some I could share, but they're also a bit tricky. If you wanted, perhaps I could teach you after this game?
If you're that curious, would you mind until after the game? I feel they could only be learned so quickly with demonstration.
For what it's worth, I'm no stranger to these reactions. I've fought alongside many crusaders by now, and a lot of them tend to withhold their trust at first too.
I see... many crusaders I've spoken with have said similar. They wanted something beyond the ordinary lives their families had, and set off to fight in the name of justice and peace.

Well... Hypnosis, for one. Putting my victims under a spell of seduction, basically. Shapeshifting would often help with that, changing to suit their desires. And of course... feeding off their souls.

Goodness, you truly are courageous! But please, there's no need to throw in your lot like that - it isn't the kind of place that should be ventured into lightly. Even the Fifth Crusade is still preparing for the day.
If I am, then I'd prefer not to find out. The only ones I want to fear my powers anymore are the demons and their followers.

<s>Mortals go there to find all sorts of things - bloodsports, brothels, souvenirs and slaves. But if they aren't careful, they could end up captured and made part of the very things they came to enjoy. I greatly await when I can destroy it all.</s>
Haha, no, no! I've seen fresh-faced crusaders kill those just as easily too. No, I'm referring to a group of Nabasus and Vrocks.
Haha, of course not! Such a group would've barely been a challenge. These were Nabasus and Vrocks we faced.
Oh, not at all! Even if I have to be separate from my allies for a time, remembering how they're depending on me is company enough.
I suppose... Someone truly courageous. Someone who isn't afraid of following lofty dreams, or being kind even when it's hard.
Oh, trouble yourself not with it, Leon. Unless your Lord would take offense to such a thing, but I'd hope not.
Oh, gosh... You've actually managed to catch me off-guard with that - I'm a little embarrassed!
I don't blame you for being concerned about me, Leon. All I can do is insist that I have no intent to hurt anyone here - I promise.
Well... I appreciate your trust in me, Leon. Perhaps I can use it as further motivation to not fail here.
From what I can tell, anything else would almost be too boring for you... and I bet whoever you're with is never bored either.

On the contrary, it's probably the safest way. Despite the lewd nature of it, the fact there's no direct contact from the others means there's less risk of those old instincts coming back up. At least, I hope.
Well, yes. But the experience of consuming a soul isn't really comparable to just regular eating. They don't even really taste that different from each other!
Well, that's also true. Succubi will often see it through for their own pleasure - any their victims experience is just a side effect to them.
We're trying to defend our world from the abyssal legions assaulting it, Meia. It's quite literally a battle for our lives.
Our very world is at stake, Meia. If we fail in defending it against the demons coming forth, everything will be lost.
Maybe... but you're lucky. Making that change comes a lot easier for mortals than it does for demons like myself.
Perhaps. But demons can't change like that quite as easily as mortals can. It's literally against our nature.
Really? I can't imagine such a scenario where being compared to such a malicious demon would be a compliment.
Oh? I see... it's weird to imagine a world where people could poke fun about being anything like such a sadistic being, and not be taken as an insult.
I'm not quite sure what you're referring to... but after some help from above, I came to learn what a terrible existance I led. I turned away, and never looked back.
Um, no... Many years ago, I learned the true depth of what I lived as, or rather the lack therof. It was thanks to some divine intervention that I found the strength to choose a better path.
In a way, yes. I've found that the more I've abandoned my past instincts, the more control I've gained over those demonic qualities. They no longer reign unchecked.
I'll admit, I used to be every bit the monster you probably see me as. But I've turned my back on that person.
You seem very... certain of yourself. Have you had experience with that sort of thing before?

They do have different feelings, sometimes. The soul of a fierce warrior will often bring a sensation of boldness and determination. The soul of a scholar will have feelings like confidence and restlessness.
Oh, I wish you could hear them yourself, Nonon. The way they sing is incredible... it's like their voices are the very sound of freedom.
...Oh! Oh goodness, haha! Now I think I understand...
Something like that, yes. All succubi are created with it...
It's a demon, Kumatora. A rather... nasty one. Then again, I could easily say that about all of them.
A succubus is a demon, Kumatora. One that I wish to be nothing like.
Well, my wings aren't really for flying like that... but using them is still a joy - not to mention they look so pretty!
Is that so? Are you a particularly skilled wizard or sorcerer, then?
I don't think anyone could deny that, Leon. The same way denying arousal from a handsome, thoughtful man willing to do the same would be dishonest.
I'm glad to say I'm not. I left behind the monster I was long ago, and I've been working on redeeming myself ever since.
Oh, you don't need to worry about making it up to me, Ladybug. As for the change... well, it's a complicated affair - even as far as divine intervention goes.
Gosh... becoming a creature of love? I almost think such a title would be too prideful, yet... I cannot deny how much love I've grown for the mortal world!
For several years now, Blake. I've assassinated important demonic leaders and smuggled info even before I joined the Crusade officially.
Well, I'll at least say that I won't give you a reason to be scared. I promise, I am not like most other demons.
Indeed! She's a very kind and loving goddess - only someone like her would've been able to help me start changing for the better.
Yes, it was that bad. I can never truly make up for the thousands of innocents I killed... I can only hope to move onto something better.
Well, let's just say it was a mix of introspection and divine intervention. I cannot deny that I've been incredibly lucky.
It's been quite the stroke of luck, without a doubt. My self-reflection likely would've been impossible without the help from above I received.
I'm not entirely sure myself... Though they glow whenever we're caught in the deepest heat of passion, so perhaps it's connected to that?
Well... they glow whenever we're in the high point of lecherous thrill with someone, so maybe that's part of it? I don't know for certain.
Are you certain about that, Trixie? You've got quite the wicked charm to you, after all!
Really? I don't know, Trixie... your devilish smile might say otherwise!
I see... I wouldn't have thought of it like that. But now that you mention, I like it!
Your father's a vampire? So... you're actually a mix between a succubus and a dhampir?
I appreciate that. I won't act like it never happened, but I'd still prefer to not think about it.
That's right - it's all real. Sorry, I forget not every world out there is likely familiar with the concept of demons!
That's a good way of viewing it, actually. The more people there are, the more lives you can positively change with your actions...
Correct. It's not like I can't still, Mari. But with all that happened before, I just choose not to.
I'm sure yours will grow out eventually, Mari! You probably won't have to wait too long for your wings, either!
Everything you've probably feared, really. Hateful, sadistic, delighting only in their own selfishness... Everything I've worked to not be.
As awful as you can imagine, unfortunately. Manifestations of all the evil, greed, and spite in the world... Nothing I regret leaving behind.
It was my... moral awakening. I realized how empty and wretched the life of a demon is, and strove to be something more than that.
Basically, I... reevaluated myself. I understood for the first time what a miserable existence I led, and started abandoning everything demonic within me.
I'm flattered, Nico! I've certainly worked a lot to distance myself from the behavior of other succubi, so it gives me hope to hear others say that.
Thank you, Nico! It honestly pleases me to hear you say that, considering how much I've struggled to overcome my nature as a succubus.
Well, the Abyss does have deities - but they're a lot more physical and real, to the point where most demons are bound to them.
It's a bit long and complicated, but... basically, mortal souls who are sent to the Abyss turn into larvae that eventually mutate based on their sinful history.
I could tell they lived hard lives - mortal species with bad reputations tend to when living with others. But they had such an inspiring selflessness and heroism about them.
Thank you. I certainly hope you're right - I wouldn't be here if I didn't reasonably think otherwise - but it's hard not to worry.
Oh, it's not bad at all! I'm just surprised - even young demons tend to have seen at least a few.
Oh, I'm not judging or anything! Succubi tend to be well-known and commonly seen among demons, so I didn't expect I'd be your first.
Really? Where I come from, such a concept quite literally is unheard of. Your world must be far luckier than mine.
Doesn't that make it even better? To share such a passionate moment with someone and put your all into it, ceased only by your own limits?
It was, once. A long time ago, before I resolved to become someone different. I truly don't wish to make issues for you.
Oh no, not at all! Desna has plenty of worshippers already - I doubt she'd need my help.
Gosh, that's such a gallant thought! I've never touched a sword and shield, though - I've always felt most comfortable with a bow.
Ahaha, thank you! I'm far more used to a bow than I am a sword, but now I wonder how I'd look adorned in knightly vestments...
"Booze and snacks"? Well, it sounds like some of these youkai just want to have a good time, Reimu! Are they really so vexatious?
Well... in truth, to challenge myself. You're not the first mortals I've talked with like this, and that was only after a long while of changing.
It was the divine intervention of Desna, the goddess of dreams. She showed the the hopes and dreams of every mortal whose soul I had consumed... how much they lived for, and how little I did.
I think I know what you mean. I've observed the world in similar ways, just from watching mortals live their lives and how they chase what they live for.
Really? Do mortals in your world see signs of her presence, or someone similar to her?
Haha, it's quite alright, Nadeshiko! I just wasn't expecting it from you, that's all!
I think of... a creature of malice. Something made of malevolent magic older than most living things, taking a form capable of its most preferred way to bring suffering.
This is... Are you sure they were demons? Not just mortals who might've had some odd attributes?
Magical girls...? You mean wizards or sorceresses? I mean, we do, but those are far from the only crusaders in Golarion.
Oh, it was a secret alright - something not even she knew about! It wasn't until later that she learned her pan had somehow been made with cold iron; the special metal that demons are weak to!
Oh, ahah, forgive me, Shamiko. It's just hard for me not to feel so devoted to my crusade, after all I've seen. But rest assured, among everything I'd want to protect, you're one of them!
...Oh, I'm not, by the way. Thought I should just mention.
Any armor worth its value should be relatively painless to remove... as I'm sure you know, ~militarytarget~.
Armor always works best when you're well-familiar with it. I can't see myself easily trading with ~militarytarget~ and fighting just as well, for example.
I've grown quite attached to my armor by this point - losing it here would be a real shame. I'm sure you understand, ~militarytarget~.
You know, in relaxed times like this, my mind drifts to the songs in my dreams, the ones I hear the Azatas singing...
Have any of you heard the songs of the Azatas? They're the celestials of Elysium, the ones whose songs reach all free hearts...
Too many bards and other storytellers overlook the importance of an undershirt. You'd never be able to adorn armor without it.
It's far too easy for others to forget the purpose of the undershirt. Even the most well-made armor would chafe without it.
Even when crusaders face budget problems, they never skimp on a good undershirt. An uncomfortable one would be too big a disadvantage.
This armor has saved my life many times. Who knows - perhaps it'll be what saves me in this game, too!
Never underestimate the strength of well-tanned leather. It can give you an edge against arrows and smaller blades - or in games like this.
Little tip of the trade; if someone is relieved to get out of their leather armor, then it wasn't made very well.
I'll admit, I think I've truly become comfortable with this place. Once I would've dreaded being at this point.
The longer this game's gone on, the less I've become concerned with falling into my own instincts. Otherwise, I wouldn't have made it this far.
I've truly come far with reforming myself, haven't I? Even though I admittedly had some concerns before we began.
It's been a while since I've shown myself off to mortals like this - and I'm going to make the most of it!
I've dreamed quite a bit of getting to do this in a wholly wholesome setting... and now I finally get to live it out!
Oh my... I'm showing myself to mortals, devoid of any dark urges... it's almost too good to be true!
Be still, my heart - this is the first time since I left my demonic ways that I have gone this far!
You're about to see all of me... and I'll savor every bit of it!
In a way, this is the first time I've ever done this... as the woman I am now!
You really haven't? Gosh, I'm quite surprised - I thought they were common knowledge to everyone who knew about demons!
Well... that's exactly what I'm looking for, Toph.
I won't lie, it does feel quite fulfilling. With every demon I slay, I make up for another one of my past sins, and save another mortal they would've brought harm to.
Interesting indeed... I'd imagine being locked out of your powers like that would more than a little traumatic in its own right.

Seeing us coming, the elf regaled the dragon with tales of a cursed land and a baron who tamed it. While it was distracted, we made our approach... and jumped it by surprise! It still put up a fight, but we won!
I couldn't agree more, Toph. And if things go even further from here... well, then I'll be happy to go all the way!
No different from the mockery I've already heard dozens of times over, Nagatoro. You jest at a heart that's too bored to care.
Haha! Struck a nerve, now, did I?
I couldn't agree more, Aaravi. It does my heart good to think about their victims resting easier now.
Absolutely, Aaravi. No matter how many ghouls they raise, they'll never be a match for the forces of righteousness and good.
Well, I think my seduction and soul-draining powers no longer happen unconsciously... that's what I'm here to test, actually.
Funny you say that - I've suspected I can't accidentally beguile and harm anyone just from my touch anymore. In fact, that's what I'm hoping tonight will prove.
Excellent - then I'd be delighted to teach you, Aaravi!
Perfect! I'll be honored to be your mentor, Aaravi!
They truly are - I'm proud to stand alongside the crusaders! Though, make sure you fight wisely as well as bravely; I doubt your comrades would want to see you fall so brutally.
I don't know for sure. But considering all that happens during, it's probably some perverse blend of horrible pain and unspeakable pleasure... a twisted caricature of mortal sensations.
You'd truly wish to join? Gosh... I never expected I'd meet such an exemplar of bravery and heroism like you here, Darkness!
Indeed. Thankfully, it doesn't progress beyond pretty words and looks - a knife in the back makes sure of that!
Any portal leading to the Abyss will likely have the city as one of the first paths before it. If you ever do find yourself standing before such a portal, Darkness... tread carefully.
Oh no, not quite. I mean quite literally what I say - the magic of nature itself. The kind that druids and forest spirits tap into all the time.
Any army or team lives and dies upon teamwork. As long as everyone plays their parts well, and knows why they're doing it, you've got nothing to fear!
You aren't disappointed, are you? If you were expecting some deep, dark secret, it's nothing like that - mortal affection is honestly quite simple!
Ahaha! They really would be well-suited for that, wouldn't they? Gosh, I'd love the opportunity to try it...
Songs are often a means to immortalize our thoughts and feelings, aren't they? I think it makes sense they'd stick with you even long after.
Well, when you put it like that... I suppose it'd be quite difficult to dispute, haha!
Oh! It seems I was wrong, then - and I suppose I have yet another reason to start playing better against you, haha!
If it's any assurance, Nagatoro, most of the crusader women I fight with are spunky and athletic. And I have yet to harm any of them.
I don't know... I feel like trying to compare the sensation to eating food won't be accurate no matter how you do it.
I can't hold it against you. When you've grown so accustomed to the lies and deviousness of demons, seeing one like me must feel like an obvious trap.
No, sadly. It always ends in violence and death... but I won't lie, I've fantasized about being the first who doesn't do that.
Yes, of course. But I'm hoping it won't come to that. And with how things have been going, I'm hopeful it won't!
...I've existed for a long time, Nagatoro. I have a lot to make up for.
I understand. I only hope I can prove by the end that your cation isn't necessary.
Elite Four? Goodness, that sounds like quite the prestigious title... I'd better hope it won't come to that, then.
I'm positive you're right, Nonon. But I would much prefer never finding out.
Gosh, you must truly hold her in high regard, then! It sounds like your devotion to her is second to none!
Ahaha! Of course, of course! Gosh, you really are adorable, Nonon!
It sticks out here amongst mortals for sure... Though I don't doubt some of them are into that!
Ahaha! They really would be well-suited for that, wouldn't they? Gosh, I'd love the opportunity to try it...
Haha, well, I hope you'll find me very interesting before the night's over!
Haha, indeed! Gosh to feel love like that...
Thank you, Leon. Aha, I won't lie, I'll be happy to assist you in that regard as well.
Oh gosh, stop it! You're too much, really!
Perhaps... but I think how you act to better yourself is what matters most - not merely willing to. Does that make sense, Ladybug?
Well, if you believe I'm capable of such a thing... then I'll go for it, Ladybug! I'd want any mortal whose path meets mine to remember me as a loving soul!
I'd say so, Blake. The Abyssal forces are bent on the destruction and enslavement of all mortal life. Justifying our war is one of the few easy parts.
I don't think there's anything strange about it all all, Blake! In fact, I envy the mortals who are able to experience it!
Well... thanks? I suppose?
Then it seems you've only witnessed those with far more malice. In your shoes, I'd probably be no different from you, Cheryl.
"Awkward" puts it lightly... but that's what the bow and arrows are for! Haha!
Well, the demon gatherings I go to tend not to last long... and I'm usually the only one to leave, haha!
Haha, of course. To be honest, I'm curious to see what'll happen myself, now.
Ahah, I understand. Actually, I hadn't considered it before, but now I'm wondering too...
It's fine, Trixie! Most others wouldn't think to put in this kind of effort... some would just purposefully mispronounce my name, thinking it's funny.
Gosh... This is the first time I've ever met someone like you, Mari - I'm absolutely intrigued!
Oh, you don't need to be so nervous, Sakura! I promise you I'm not like other demons; I really mean you no harm!
Thank you, Critical Darling. I've certainly been hoping that's the truth.
Perhaps one day, Mari. When I'm fully confident in who I've become, maybe I can make some new memories to associate it with.
I'm sure they will, Mari. You've been nothing but kind and sweet since we first began talking!
I agree. Should a day ever come where you do meet a more conventional demon, I only hope you find them in the interior of a cage.
Indeed. For your safety, I hope you never do have to meet a regular demon... save for one behind bars of cold iron.
It is a place, Nico, but one that doesn't follow rules typical of our reality. Though it still has its own sets of physical rules to follow.
Hmm... I suppose it's simply calculated by the amount of harm it does to others, and how much a mortal must abandon their good will to do it.
Indeed, Nami. The freedom and goodwill I now have has made everything, even the hardest parts, worth it.
Very much so, Nami. I hope I can express my newfound kindness and freedom to everyone here today, as well.
Ahaha! Gosh, you're simply too sweet, Mari!
I do, yes. I lived in the Abyss for most of my existance... and my current line of work pretty much requires me to know all I can.
That is correct. Much of my existance, I lived around other demons - experience that's proven quite useful with what I currently do.
Well, I've spent most of my existence around other demons. And when it comes to even the weakest of them... they're seldom merciful.
Yes... that makes a lot of sense. Wonderfully put, your highness!
Oh gosh, thanks! I never even considered it could look like that - it's just an undershirt, after all!
Well, what else would it be made of, Magician?
We're all born with them, pretty much. I used to view it as a mark of shame, but... maybe before long, I can learn to like it.
Well, I never said I have no reason to exist, Reimu. And I'll assume you're just joking with your proposition... since you clearly don't know what you'd be getting into.
Hm... But what of a youkai who's a friend to those fighting back against them? Would your creed run still?
Well, that depends. Would you give it fair and square?
Perhaps... but only if you'd be willing to give it!
Exactly. Your fears aren't unfounded, I admit - I used to be as truly wretched of a thing as you imagined...
Exactly! To build something, to find what matters to you and make it real... that is what gives existence its value. All I had ever done was take, and destroy.
Oh Nadeshiko, that'd be wonderful! I can clearly see how much passion you have for it, getting to watch how you do it directly would be great!
Well, I can't argue with that, now, can I? I guess if I'm going to be naughty today, it might as well be with someone like you!
Haha! I like the sound of that, Nadeshiko! Desna's as much of a traveler as her followers often are, so perhaps she does watch over you too!
Well... Just as a suggestion, maybe they'd leave you alone more often if you didn't join in. By this point, some of them probably see you as a friend!
Really? I... want to express doubt, but then again, you're right in front of me, and you're already far different from any other demon I've met!

Well, mortals don't have to know magic to fight demons. As long as they're adept with any kind of fighting, they have a chance. Actually, I once saw a Babau fought off by a mortal with just a frying pan!
I don't think you'd have anything to worry about, Shamiko. If you were near anything made of cold iron, you'd definitely know it!
Absolutely! I never would've expected to meet a demon as nice as you here, Shamiko, but I'm glad I did!
...So I hope you don't mind if I sing to myself from time to time. Nowadays, singing comes with happiness to me as much as smiling.
...I would love to share some of their music with you all. Ever since I began finding my dream, it is hard to keep myself from singing.
Haha, I imagine this would be much more inconvenient for any crusaders garbed in full plate. We'd be waiting here for several minutes!
Leaving it aside isn't much of a concern for now - this place looks quite clean!
I have no reservations if you wish to look at my armor closer. Just don't try to damage it, please!
With that, I'm as vulnerable as I can be... which is as vulnerable as any demon can be, really.
Mine was actually made from the webbing of the first Retriever - the large spider constructs the abyss uses. Quite unique for something so small, right?
My undershirt in particular is special; it was made from webbing of the first Retriever the demons ever built.
In fact, mine was made from the webbing of a large demonic spider known as a Retriever. If the forces of the Abyss can recognize it, I hope it puts true fear in their hearts.
I'm so happy to be in a place where I can do this without fear... I may be losing, but it feels like I've won what's really important!
Even after everything, I can really feel what a different person I've become. And I'm glad I get to experience that with all of you!
It might seem odd, feeling this triumphant over such a silly game - but I cannot stop myself regardless!
This is me, everyone. I feel I owe you a thanks for trusting me enough to let me do this.
In a way, I can scarcely believe this. I've truly come so far from the dark and wicked creature I once was...
It's funny - I've slain scores of demons and helped make many vital decisions in the course of the war... yet this personal victory feels truly unlike any other.
The way you're all looking is so... Oh gosh, I can barely contain myself!
This may be the first time a succubus has shown off her chest without duplicitous intent... Haha, if the forces of the Abyss could see me now!
I know I've done this thousands of times before... yet it feels like my breasts are truly being viewed for the first time!

state.text: So these bio-weapons you mentioned - they're things that transform people into monsters?

case.state: Don't worry too much about before, Anatoly - I've faced a lot of worse scorn before, so I don't take it personal from your friend there.

state.text: You have such an intense stare, Takatoshi... you've seen a lot, haven't you?
I recognize the look on your face, Takatoshi... I often see it on soldiers who've witnessed enough for two lifetimes.
Gosh, you really look like you know what you're doing! I don't expect you'll make this easy for us, Yuno!
Wow, I didn't expect to be playing against someone with such a passion like yours, Yuno! I should be prepared for what you've got, shouldn't I?

case.state: Oh, your little friend is adorable, Anatoly! What a cute little creature!
Gosh, you've got such an adorable friend there, Anatoly! How cute!

state.text: You work for your government, Leon? You wouldn't happen to be a... "minister", would you?
A government worker, you said... if I had to guess, Leon, would you happen to be a "minister"?

case.state: Forgive my shock, angel. I did not expect someone like you to be here to~background.time~.
I beg your pardon, angel. I'm simply surprised - seeing someone like you here has caught me off-guard.

state.text: Would it be alright if I asked what your job involves, Leon? Or is it too discreet even for here?
Goodness, you look strong! You wouldn't be at all out of place standing next to the Crusade's champions!
It's fascinating to meet a soldier like you here - you don't seem at all fazed by how different my equipment must be from yours.
Armor fitting is actually quite an important logistical concern, given how many different people can join an army. How do you manage it, Jim?
How do you manage supplies for your army, Jim? It's not glamorous like the other parts, but it's perhaps the most important.
Making sure you can reliably get new recruits is no laughing matter, in any kind of war. How did you go about that, Jim?
The phrase 'Know thy enemy' is oft-spoken among many worlds for good reason. How do you keep your troops informed about who they're fighting?
So... how are living arrangements, Jim? For your troops, I mean.
Oh, gosh, am I really so obvious, Jim?

case.state: Gosh, you've got a lot of confidence for a regular mortal like you, don't you? How grand!
I don't typically see average mortals like yourself with so much conviction in your skill. I like seeing that!
You gave a good effort, ~name~ - be proud of that!
Sorry, ~name~, but someone had to lose no matter what. Quarrel with the game, not the players!
I did it! Oh, um, not to rub it in or anything, ~name~.
Look on the bright side, ~name~ - now you can choose how to impress us!
You have the floor now, ~name~. Make the most of it!
That's you, ~name~. What will it be?
Oh my, ~name~'s turn? I can't help but feel lucky...
You wouldn't... mind if I stared, would you, ~name~? It's in the spirit of the game, after all!
I promise I won't do anything funny, ~name~! You've just arrested my gaze, is all.
Praise Desna - I'm still in it!
I'm glad I still have a chance here. Especially if I get to see you strip more, ~name~.
You've got a lot to look at, ~name~. Don't keep it all to yourself!
Surrounded by beautiful people, watching them strip bare around me... no wonder so many bards fantasize about this.
What a joy this is - to watch such wholesome debauchery in the midst of such an act!
Oh, please... Will you help me and my lecherous view, ~name~?
You're so... ah, handsome, ~name~... please be generous, too!
Sorry, ~name~! Wait... why am I apologizing?
I know the feeling, ~name~. Believe me!
You've still got this, ~name~. I believe in you!
Don't let it get to you, ~name~. Even Desna can't always stop bad luck.

state.text: Your guitar from earlier was made of ice, wasn't it? Are they all constructed like that?

case.state: Oh, how I enjoy a good love story... especially one that comes so unexpected!
You seem quite proud of adventuring solo, Aaravi. Have you always done it that way?
Did you always go on adventures by yourself, Aaravi? From the way you talk about it, I'd assume so.
I suppose it makes sense why you don't travel with parties, Aaravi. Still, it has to get lonely sometimes.
Even if you enjoy travelling alone more, Aaravi, doesn't it feel lonely from time to time?
♫~player~ and Nagatoro, sitting in a tree, F-U-C---♫
So, Toph, when you say you can sense our vibrations, do you mean you can hear our movements? Even subtle ones?
So, if you can already see what we look like, for all intents and purposes... why did you decide you wanted to play this, Toph?
I can't help but admire you, Toph. You're so eager and confident about exposing yourself here... Meanwhile I'm a lot more nervous about it.
I guess it wouldn't hurt to ask - how do you do it, Toph? Feel so confident with yourself?
You know, I'm glad I met you today, Toph. I feel like talking with you has given me motivation to harden my resolve.
Well, if you want to get stronger to protect the ones you care about, Shamiko... I'd be happy to help you.
You're really dedicated to getting stronger to help the ones you love, aren't you? Please, Shamiko - let me help you.
Alright, Shamiko, so you want to help your friends when they're going through some rough times, yes?
Oh, it's no issue, Shamiko! So... in the circumstance where you know your friend is dealing with something but won't say anything, I've learned it helps to be a bit indirect.
I should also mention, Shamiko - don't stress too much about experience this early. Everything becomes easier the more you do it, and you have to start somewhere!
Come on - surely it's at least a little fun to be losing like this, right? In fact, getting knocked out entirely is arguably the most fun part!
I hope you don't think I'm working against you specifically, Nonon. It's just that you're very fortunate right now, and I wanted to help you remember that.
Getting into it now, aren't you, Nonon? I noticed you've saved the best two things for last!
I'm glad to see you're getting more into it, Nonon. I always love seeing mortals having so much fun with stuff like this!
Actually, I've been wondering, Aaravi - have you ever fought for a specific cause, beyond killing monsters?
I take it most of your adventuring has been spent fighting for glory, Aaravi, but has there ever been a larger cause you've lent your arms to?

state.text: A vampire of nobility? I wasn't expecting to have such company tonight.
Huh... I'm no stranger to the company of vampires, but I didn't think one of a noble line would show up here.
It's always a pleasure to meet another paladin, Luxanna. To which deity are you sworn?
I'm happy to meet a paladin such as yourself, Luxanna. May I ask which deity you serve?
I wasn't sure what to expect here, but a cleric certainly wasn't one of them! What brought you here, Barbara?
What drew you to the Inventory, Barbara? I wouldn't have guessed to find a cleric in a place like this.
You mentioned you're a soldier-in-training, Leonie? What's the story behind that?
What made you decide to start training to be a soldier, Leonie? Everyone's got their own story for it.
Gosh, you two are excited to be here! Do you come here often?
It's funny - I was a bit nervous about coming here at first, yet here you two are, excited the moment you stepped in!
I wasn't sure if I should ask, but... are you an assassin, Susie?
The knife, the mask, the dark hood... I hate to be rude, but you're not an assassin, are you, Susie?
It's funny - I wondered if I'd feel out-of-sorts here, but finding a vampire's already made me feel at home!
I've never given much thought to other planes like these, but I suppose it's not too surprising to find vampires here among other mortals!
The work of alchemists has always fascinated me. Your mutagens, potions, bombs... How do you even think to create them?
Alchemy's always been a mystery to me, but I admire it deeply. All the work that must go into creating your bombs, potions, mutagens...
It's not common to find a shrine maiden far from her place of worship. Your faith must be pretty liberal, right?
Your faith isn't very strict, is it, Reimu? Most shrine maidens where I'm from don't stray far from their temples.
So... you said you're also a succubus, Mari? I assume that's why you're here then...
Gosh, you're absolutely adorable, Mari! Your clothes, your hair - right down to your smile!
Goodness, Mari, you're so cute! Your eyes, your voice - I'm delighted you're here with us now!
Those tools at your sides, Revy... They wouldn't happen to be advanced firearms, would they?
Hm... If I had to guess, are those items on your sides advanced firearms, Revy?
Ah, Sakura! You mentioned being part of a group of bards, correct?
If I'm correct, Sakura, you brought up being from a bardic fellowship earlier, right?
It's amazing, thinking about the songs that exist in other worlds. So many different tunes, from all sorts of cultures and people...
I noticed your lyre earlier - if you don't mind me saying, it was quite unlike any I've seen!
You were holding some type of lyre earlier, weren't you? At least, I assume it was - it didn't look like any I've ever seen before!
...You're an elf, aren't you? And yet your clothing is unlike anything the ones from Golarion wear...
Strange... Your clothing is nothing that could've come from Golarion, yet you're very clearly an elf...
You have shown a remarkable amount of restraint so far, Mari. Have you been in situations like this before?
From the way you talk about the yokai, Reimu, I take it you must have a long-standing grudge with them. Is that correct?
You carry yourself so mightily, your Highness... I wouldn't have guessed someone like you would be interested in this place.
I'm surprised to see someone like you here, your Highness. This isn't the sort of place I'd associate with proud rulers like you.
Are you alright, Sakura? You're looking a little pale.
Gosh... So you really are a zombie. Then why didn't you say so sooner? Why go to the trouble of covering up?
I have to ask... do the other members of Franchouchou know you're a zombie yet?
Imagine that, a group of zombies coming together as bards - or idols, like you said... That's simply amazing!
Fate has been whimsical today indeed. I'm no stranger to the company of the undead, but I didn't expect a zombie disguised as a human to join tonight!
Gosh, it's great to see an adventurer here! You wouldn't happen to be involved in the Pathfinder Society, would you, Aaravi?
I didn't know if I'd find an adventurer at this place, but it's nice to meet you, Aaravi! Are you connected to the Pathfinder Society?
You're an utterly fascinating case, Mari. So you continue to explore your lustful desires, without ever bringing harm to who you're with?

case.state: Excuse my curiosity, Nagatoro, but why exactly is ~player~ a creep like you say?
So, if ~player~'s really a pervert like you say, why did you come here with them to begin with, Nagatoro?
Wait... Hm-hm-hm! I think I just figured you out, Nagatoro!
So... how bad are these youkai, Reimu? If they need a regular "exterminator", then...
Goodness me, I didn't know I'd find a goblin here! Especially not an adventurer, too!
My word, I already wasn't expecting to see another adventurer at this place, but one who's a goblin? This is quite a wonder!
I truly wasn't expecting to see a crusader like you here, Darkness. I know all of them aren't like this, but some of them have pretty chaste vows.
My, you're both excited! Is this when you finally show that gimmick of yours?
Forgive me if this sounds odd, Mari, but I find you truly inspiring. I've spent so long not knowing if what I've worked towards could be fruitful or not, and now I know for sure!
Haha, quite the enthusiast for games of chance, aren't you?
So what do you find so compelling about gambling, Yumeko?
You, um, seem quite enthusiastic about the concept of a game having the risk of losing something, aren't you?
If you insist on knowing, Yumeko, my reason for being here isn't just to relax with a game. It's to see how far I can overcome my nature.
You seem quite... taken with my true reason for being here, Yumeko. Why?
Yumeko, please, don't even suggest things like what you said! I don't want to hurt anyone here!
It sounds like Gensokyo is quite the dangerous place to live... surviving there must not be easy.
Forgive me, Shamiko, but... are you really a demon?
I can feel the abyssal energy all over you, but... was I wrong in assuming you're a demon, Shamiko?
I simply don't understand, Shamiko. You're already so kind and friendly - why would you want to be more demon-like?
Why would someone like you want to be closer to a demon, Shamiko? Someone as nice and sweet as you... it doesn't make any sense to me.
I've seen eyes like yours before, Toph... Forgive me if this is rude, but would you happen to be blind?
Goodness, you're dressed so ornately... Are you by any chance a noble, Lysithea?
Such a decorated dress... Correct me if I'm wrong, Lysithea, but are you part of a noble house?
You've had quite the determined posture this whole time, Lysithea. Does victory in this game mean that much to you?
I recall you mentioning your inclination towards strategy, Lysithea. Is what why you decided to play this game?
"A place that accepts the fantastical and rejects the mundane"... Was it meant to be that chaotic by design, Reimu?
Forgive me, Nonon, but you seem rather... out of sorts here.
I don't wish to assume, but you seem awful competitive about this, Nonon.
You strike me as the sort to hold much pride in your noble house, Lysithia. What is it you seek to accomplish for it?

state.text: Ah, that's an excellent idea, your Highness! Please, allow me to join!
You are... an elf? I apologize, you just don't look like any I've seen before.
Forgive my rudeness, Trifle, but... are you an elf? You have the ears, but I'm confused by the rest.

case.state: I hope you don't mind losing, ~name~. I don't think anyone else here does!
As long as you tried your best, you've got nothing to be sorry about, ~name~.
I'm relieved to be doing this well - to be honest, none of my games with the other crusaders go as good for me.
All eyes are on you, ~name~. Oh, not to stress you out or anything!
I'm looking forward to this, ~name~! Oh, uh, not to be too forward or anything.
Yes! Oh, I mean... you played well, ~name~!
Don't take it personally, ~name~. Then again, I do want to see you strip, so... is it personal?
Phew! I didn't know how that round would turn out for a second there.
I've seen a lot of pretty female crusaders in Drezen - but I've never gotten the privilege of seeing them strip down like this.
I came to experience the innocent joy of libido tonight, ~name~. I would love it if you shared your joy with us!
You look beautiful, ~name~ - you have nothing to be afraid of!
I'm not saying I don't sympathize with you, ~name~, but... I'm not saying I won't enjoy this either!
You're not out just yet, ~name~. Don't lose hope!
Roll with the punches, ~name~. That's something my friend Seelah likes to say!
Carry on, ~name~. There's still plenty of game left.
It's up to you; what will you take off now?
I can barely wait... Show me your beauty, ~name~!
So much joy here... What a wonderful place this is!
You're- oh, so pretty, ~name~. Please, bare yourself without fear!
I've let you gaze upon so much of myself... Won't you give me something in return?

state.text: A tie? In Poker?! I didn't even know such a thing was possible!

case.state: I understand if you want to start slow. This is a very different kind of encounter, after all.
